author: dws
msg: * packages/rpm/subversion.spec : Now requires apache-2.0.32-0.3 or greater.
I forgot to increment the release version last time.

author: rooneg
msg: Oops.  Last commit broke 'make check'.  This fixes it.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/svntest/tree.py
(get_props): pass '--verbose' to 'svn plist' so we get both the names
and values of properties.

author: rooneg
msg: Previously, 'svn propget' and 'svn proplist' printed out both the property
names and the property values on their targets.  In addition, 'svn propget'
would always print out the name of the file or directory in question.
In the case of 'svn propget', this becomes problematic becuase people are
prone to doing an 'svn propget', then editing the output and using it as the
value for a propset, thus resulting in a property value that contains the
name of the property, which is almost certainly not what they want.
In the case of 'svn proplist', it just doesn't make sense to list the values,
and only clutters up the output.
This changes the behavior to the following:  'svn proplist' will only print
the names of the properties, unless '--verbose' is specified.  'svn propget'
will only print the values, and will only print the filenames if there is
more than one target or '--recursive' was specified and svn_client_propget
returned multiple files that matched that property.
This fixes issue #627.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/cl.h
add prototype and docstring for svn_cl__print_prop_names.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/props.c
(svn_cl__print_prop_names): new function.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/propget-cmd.c
(print_prop): deleted.
(svn_cl__propget): print filenames only if necessary, and don't print
property name at all, since it never changes.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/proplist-cmd.c
(svn_cl__proplist): only call svn_cl__print_prop_hash if verbose was
specified, otherwise use svn_cl__print_prop_names.
* subversion/clients/cmdline/main.c
(svn_cl__cmd_table): add 'v' to the entry for svn_cl__proplist.

author: brane
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/svn_error.c: Wrap the definitions of error_file
and error_line inside SVN_DEBUG, to silence gcc warning about those vars
not being used.
Suggested by: Blair Zajac <blair@orcaware.com>
(Who noticed the new warning here.)

author: brane
msg: I hear people are having trouble finding where Subversion errors come from.
This little patch will fix them. (The troubles, not the people. :-)
* subversion/include/svn_types.h (svn_error_t): Added fields file and line.
* subversion/include/svn_error.h (svn_error__locate): New prototype.
(svn_error_create, svn_error_createf, svn_error_quick_wrap): New macros,
defined iff SVN_DEBUG, that wrap a call to svn_error__locate around
the error creating functions.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/svn_error.c
(SVN_ERROR_POOL, SVN_ERROR_POOL_ROOTED_HERE): Change to static arrays.
Doesn't make sense to duplicate those strings.
(SVN_FILE_LINE_UNDEFINED): New string: "svn:<undefined>"
(svn_error__locate): New function. Remember the current error location.
(make_error_internal): Copy the error location into the svn_error_t.
(svn_handle_error): If SVN_DEBUG, print out the error location before
displaying the error.
(svn_pool_create, svn_pool_clear): Use SVN_FILE_LINE_UNDEFINED instead
of a string literal in the ..._debug call.
